items.title: The alarm: Tropical virus is spreading in northern Europe
items.summary: "Pretty shocking" - that's how researchers describe their own new calculations that show that the chikungunya virus can spread further north in Europe than previously thought.
items.title_original: Larmet: Tropiskt virus sprids i norra Europa
items.summary_original: ”Ganska chockerande” – så beskriver forskare sina egna nya beräkningar som visar att  chikungunyaviruset kan spridas längre norrut i Europa än man tidigare har trott.

items.title: Eight prisons will receive minors
items.summary: Now the government and SD are taking the next step towards youth prisons. As early as July, Rosersberg, Kumla and Sagsjön will be able to accept children from the age of 13.
items.title_original: Åtta fängelser ska ta emot minderåriga
items.summary_original: Nu tar regeringen och SD nästa steg mot ungdomsfängelser. Redan i juli kommer Rosersberg, Kumla och Sagsjön kunna ta emot barn från 13 år.

items.title: Letter to the editor. Is the idea of ​​effect fee that we should stop pork pancake?
items.summary: LETTER TO THE EDITOR. It would be highly reasonable to remove the power charge for all households that consume little electricity. Because the idea of ​​the new penalty could not have been that we should avoid cooking hot food at dinner time, could it? wonders Marie Morin.
items.title_original: Insändare. Är tanken med effektavgift att vi ska sluta med fläskpannkaka?
items.summary_original: INSÄNDARE. Det vore högst rimligt att ta bort effektavgiften för alla hushåll som förbrukar lite el. För tanken med den nya straffavgiften kan väl inte ha varit att vi ska undvika laga varm mat vid middagstid? undrar Marie Morin.

items.title: Government intends to propose Swedish loan guarantee to World Bank to enable SEK 2.5 billion in new budget support to Ukraine
items.summary: The Government intends to enable a loan of an additional SEK 2.5 billion to Ukraine via the World Bank by guaranteeing repayment of the loan. This means that Sweden will enable additional budget support to Ukraine in early 2026.
items.title_original: Government intends to propose Swedish loan guarantee to World Bank to enable SEK 2.5 billion in new budget support to Ukraine

items.title: Ebba Busch to take part in high-level AI meeting in India
items.summary: On 18–20 February, Deputy Prime Minister Ebba Busch will be in New Delhi to take part in the AI Impact Summit. The Summit gathers leaders from more than 30 countries and aims to promote international cooperation in the area of AI.
items.title_original: Ebba Busch to take part in high-level AI meeting in India

items.title: Support to Ukraine, security policy cooperation and gender equality in focus for this year’s Statement of Foreign Policy
items.summary: Today, 18 February, Minister for Foreign Affairs Maria Malmer Stenergard presented the Government’s 2026 Statement of Foreign Policy in the Riksdag. The Government’s foremost foreign policy priorities are support to Ukraine and increased pressure on Russia, stronger cooperation in security and trade, and gender equality and women’s empowerment.

items.title: New strategy for reform cooperation with Eastern Europe, the Western Balkans and Türkiye
items.summary: The Government has adopted a new strategy for Sweden’s reform cooperation with Eastern Europe, the Western Balkans and Türkiye for 2026–2030. The aim of the strategy is to strengthen the countries’ reform efforts and bring them closer to the EU.

items.title: Sweden and Ukraine agree to cooperate on cybersecurity
items.summary: Cyber attacks are one of the tactics used by Russia in its war against Ukraine. Sweden and Ukraine have now reached an agreement aimed at strengthening Ukraine’s resilience to cyber attacks, which also enhances Sweden’s capability to cope with sophisticated cyber threats.
items.title_original: Sweden and Ukraine agree to cooperate on cybersecurity
items.summary_original: Cyber attacks are one of the tactics used by Russia in its war against Ukraine. Sweden and Ukraine have now reached an agreement aimed at strengthening Ukraine’s resilience to cyber attacks, which also enhances Sweden’s capability to cope with sophisticated cyber threats.

items.title: Increased support for social and medical reforms in Ukraine
items.summary: Sweden’s support to Ukraine makes a difference. The Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida) has approved increased funding for the National Board of Health and Welfare’s programme for expanded support to Ukraine for health and medical care, care of older people and children.

items.title: The Riksbank exchanges EU payments
items.summary: Sweden's membership in the EU means monthly payments to the EU's budget. These are made in Swedish kronor by the Swedish government and are normally exchanged for euros on the foreign exchange market by a receiving central bank within the EU.
items.title_original: Riksbanken växlar EU-betalning
items.summary_original: Sveriges medlemskap i EU innebär månatliga betalningar till EU:s budget. Dessa görs i svenska kronor av den svenska staten och växlas normalt till euro på valutamarknaden av en mottagande centralbank inom EU.

items.title: Göran Hjelm new deputy governor of the Riksbank
items.summary: The Riksbank General Council decided today to appoint Göran Hjelm as a new member of the Riksbank's Executive Board. Göran Hjelm succeeds Anna Breman, who left the Riksbank at the end of last year.
items.title_original: Göran Hjelm ny vice riksbankschef
items.summary_original: Riksbanksfullmäktige beslutade idag att utse Göran Hjelm till ny direktionsledamot i Riksbanken. Göran Hjelm efterträder Anna Breman som lämnade Riksbanken i slutet på förra året.

items.title: Government presents new energy package for Ukraine
items.summary: Today, the Government presented a new SEK 1 billion support package for Ukraine’s energy sector, which has been subjected to intensive Russian strikes this winter. The support will help to meet the country’s urgent energy needs and bolster long-term energy supplies.
items.title_original: Government presents new energy package for Ukraine
items.summary_original: Today, the Government presented a new SEK 1 billion support package for Ukraine’s energy sector, which has been subjected to intensive Russian strikes this winter. The support will help to meet the country’s urgent energy needs and bolster long-term energy supplies.

items.title: Pål Jonson in Brussels for several high-level meetings
items.summary: On 11 and 12 February, Minister for Defence Pål Jonson will take part in the meeting of EU Defence Ministers and the Meeting of NATO Ministers of Defence. In conjunction with the NATO Defence Ministers meeting, a meeting will also take place within the framework of the Ukraine Defense Contact Group. Increased support to Ukraine will be a central theme of all three meetings.
